[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/bcs.rs] [Edge Case] [Zero-sized types] Does serialization of zero-sized types (like empty structs) charge appropriate gas and handle correctly? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/bcs.rs] [Edge Case] [Signer serialization] Does legacy_signer mode in serialization (line 98) maintain consistency across validator upgrades? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/bcs.rs] [Edge Case] [Function value serialization] Can function values be serialized, and if so, does deserialization preserve function identity securely? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/bcs.rs] [Edge Case] [Native type wrapping] For MoveTypeLayout::Native wrapping (lines 262-268), does recursive unwrapping prevent infinite loops? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/bcs.rs] [Edge Case] [Enum variant serialization] Do RuntimeVariants and WithVariants handle all variant tags correctly without overlap or gaps? (High)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/vector.rs] [Edge Case] [Zero-length move] Does move_range handle length=0 correctly without unnecessary allocations or gas charges? (Low)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/vector.rs] [Edge Case] [Self-move operation] If from and to are the same vector, does move_range handle overlapping ranges correctly? (High)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/vector.rs] [Edge Case] [Capacity exhaustion] Can moving elements into a vector cause reallocation failures that crash validators? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/vector.rs] [Edge Case] [Maximum vector size] Does move_range properly handle vectors at maximum size (2^64-1 elements) without overflow? (High)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Edge Case] [Empty string operations] Do all string functions handle empty strings correctly without panics or underflows? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Edge Case] [Multi-byte character boundaries] Does is_char_boundary correctly identify all valid UTF-8 character boundaries including edge cases? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Edge Case] [Substring at string end] Does sub_string handle i==j==string.len() correctly without out-of-bounds access? (Low)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Edge Case] [Pattern longer than string] Does index_of handle cases where pattern is longer than string without overflow? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/string.rs] [Edge Case] [Surrogate pair handling] Are UTF-8 surrogate pairs properly rejected or do they pass validation and cause issues later? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/cmp.rs] [Edge Case] [Recursive structure comparison] Does comparison of recursive structures terminate correctly or can it loop infinitely? (High)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/cmp.rs] [Edge Case] [NaN comparison] If Move supports floating point, does comparison handle NaN values deterministically? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/cmp.rs] [Edge Case] [Reference comparison] Does comparing references compare referents or reference identities? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mem.rs] [Edge Case] [Swap with self] Does swap handle left==right correctly without corruption? (Low)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/mem.rs] [Edge Case] [Large value swap] For very large values, does swap operation properly handle memory pressure? (Medium)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/hash.rs] [Edge Case] [Maximum input length] Do hash functions handle maximum-sized inputs (2^64-1 bytes) without overflow? (Low)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/hash.rs] [Edge Case] [Hash output encoding] Is hash output encoding (to_vec) consistent across all architectures and endianness? (Low)
[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/reflect.rs] [Edge Case] [Non-existent function] Does resolve_function properly handle non-existent functions without crashing? (Low)

[File: aptos-move/framework/move-stdlib/src/natives/reflect.rs] [Edge Case] [Circular module dependencies] Can resolve_function handle circular module dependencies without stack overflow? (Medium)
